document_data.name: Mirini Elemys
document_data.mainbody:
Quote
|I have told the story of my enslavement and escape many times over to these good wizards. They believe that with my knowledge, it is possible to bring the Drow House Avithoul to its knees — by a slave revolt. Nothing would shame and humiliate them more. Nothing would make me happier.
|Mirini
}}
Mirini was taken from her woodland home in a [[drow]] slave raid, and spent years as a prisoner of [[House Avithoul]], a drow House famed for its slavery. She was handled by [[Solul the Slavebreaker]], a particularly vicious drow man, and brutalized into submission with physical and magical tortures. Finally, she was controlled with a ''[[drow slave collar]]'', which kept a slave's body obedient to the commands of the nearest slavemaster even as their mind rebelled.

During her time there, Mirini earned the (relative) good graces of the House Matron, [[Balbaste Avithoul]], and was given special treatment—that is, kept close to more easily torment on a whim. This allowed Mirini to closely observe Avithoul's compound and their ''[[portal]]s'' which led elsewhere in the [[Underdark]]. Around the time of the [[Sschindylryn invasion of Eveningstar]], Mirini finally managed to disable her own ''slave collar'' through luck and diligence (normally a lethal trick to attempt), and having won control of her own body, she stole a ''[[invisibility|wand of invisibility]]'', leapt through one of the Matron's ''portals'', and fled through the Underdark to freedom.

Mirini eventually made her way to [[Eveningstar]] and was interviewed by the [[Wizard of War]] [[Aptem Mews]] about her escape. The details she provided gave great insights into the inner structure of the drow invasion—particularly the alliance between Houses Avithoul, [[Szind]], and [[Dun'Robar]], and the finer details of Avithoul's own operations. With the support of Cormyr's military, Mirini organized the downfall of House Avithoul by smuggling in agents disguised as slaves. The raid was a great success, and a full-fledged slave revolt broke out, killing many members of House Avithoul and depriving them of their valuable merchandise. This also helped weaken the alliance between the three houses and greatly affected their war against Cormyr.
document_data.Description: Mirini had long brown hair, gray eyes, and pale skin. In her escape, she was dressed in ragged bits of clothing with no shoes.
